image.altText: Wind turbines in the sea.

props.synopsis: The federal government formally declares a wind farm zone in Bass Strait, which will be further offshore and smaller in size after taking onboard feedback from the community.

title.children: 'You'd have to be squinting': Bass Strait wind farm zone pushed out to 30km

image.altText: Robert George Greig.

props.synopsis: A Special Operations Group officer tells a coronial inquest that allegations Tasmania Police shot a fugitive and destroyed his car with fire to destroy evidence are "absolutely incorrect".

title.children: SOG cop refutes theory police shot fugitive and burnt car

image.altText: A row of supreme court lawyers sit in their robes a wooden supreme court room for a ceremony.

props.synopsis: There is "shock and disappointment" amongst women in Tasmania's legal fraternity after the role of chief justice of Tasmania's Supreme Court went to a man "not known to have held judicial office at any time in his career", critics say.

title.children: Women angry after male lawyer with 'no judicial experience' gets top judge role

image.altText: A chain of mostly transparent bioluminescent organisms glowing blue

props.synopsis: While they may not look like it, salps are more closely related to humans than they are to jellyfish. The extraordinary numbers of them accumulating at Tasmanian beaches have delighted biologists.

title.children: What are 'salps', the jellyfish-like creatures with organs that are invading beaches?

image.altText: A Tasmanian aboriginal elder wearing  a yellow t-shirt with the aboriginal flag on it.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Aboriginal elder Jim Everett again refused attendance at a court hearing where he was convicted on multiple charges. He agreed to pay fines relating to 'social laws' but continues protesting the court's jurisdiction over him.Â

title.children: Aboriginal elder agrees to pay fine but snubs 'colonial court' fee

image.altText: Helicopter landed on a beach with people nearby.

props.synopsis: From the air it must have looked a great spot to land, a big stretch of white sand and miles from anywhere. Little did this "helicopter safari" group know, one of Tasmania's most vocal opponents to helicopters in wilderness areas was watching on.

title.children: Hiker spotted 16 helicopters landing on pristine beach, then a row started

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt checking a rain gauge.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians contribute data to the Bureau of Meteorology, but it's the Nichols family's multi-generational commitment that sets them apart.

title.children: Did you miss? ð£ Farming family recognised for century's worth of rain data

image.altText: Fans celebrate

props.synopsis: FIFA's decision to award the men's World Cup to Saudi Arabia has been widely condemned by human rights groups. But despite the global showpiece potentially shining a light on these issues, it's just as likely people won't care, writes David Mark.

title.children: Saudi World Cup decision sparks human rights uproar in football

image.altText: A young child with short dark hair and a dark top stands in front of a TV.

props.synopsis: From an awkward KFC commercial to a mobile billboard for a brothel, ad complaints from 2024 give insight into the direction the industry is taking.Â

title.children: KFC, Budget Direct and a brothel top 2024 ad-complaints list

image.altText: A person's thumb edges towards a Facebook app icon on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: The government wants Facebook and Google to pay for news after Meta refused to renew deals with media outlets. Follow live.Â

title.children: Fresh plan for tech giants to pay for Australian news

image.altText: A woman addresses the media in a press confernece.

props.synopsis: The NT chief minister and police commissioner have travelled to Alice Springs to take "urgent" action in response to what they describe as "serious, heinous, and escalating violence" in the town.Â

title.children: Chief, police commissioner fly to Alice after 'escalating' violence

image.altText: A blue Meta logo placed on the keyboard of a silver laptop

props.synopsis: Most services offered by global tech giant Meta have been brought back online after major disruptions to its key social media platforms.

title.children: Facebook, Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp back online after Meta outage

image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

props.synopsis: Taking on Regional Express and four of its directors represents a change of attitude at the corporate regulator that has been missing in action for years, if not decades.

title.children: An attitude shift led the corporate regulator to set its sights on Rex

image.altText: Two unidentified people sit at a desk with several boxes labelled MS-2 Step. One wears doctor's lab coat

props.synopsis: Family Planning Australia has analysed data on medical terminations across NSW, highlighting how access to abortion remains a postcode lottery.

title.children: Family Planning report reveals abortion deserts across regional NSW

image.altText: Military vehicles driving up a dirt road along an area separated by barbed wire

props.synopsis: Shortly after Syrian president Bashar al-Assad's overthrow by rebel forces, Israel ordered its troops to enter a demilitarised buffer zone situated along the east of Syria's Golan Heights plateau it controls.

title.children: Why the Golan Heights is a flashpoint for Israel and Syria

image.altText: Moira Deeming smiles as she walks out of court.

props.synopsis: Ms Deeming brought the lawsuit against Mr Pesutto, alleging the Liberal Party leader had defamed her as a Nazi sympathiser in the wake of an anti-trans rights rally.

title.children: Victorian Liberal leader defamed MP Moira Deeming, Federal Court rules

image.altText: A close up of Abu Mohammed al-Golani speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Syrian rebel leader Abu Mohammed al-Golani said he would hunt down anyone involved in the torture or killing of detainees during the ousted Syrian president's rule, dissolve the security forces of the former regime and close its prisons.Â

title.children: Syria's Golani vows to punish those responsible for torture under Assad

image.altText: Israel graffitti

props.synopsis: It comes after anti-Israel vandalism was graffitied in Sydney's east, which isÂ home to one of Australia's largest Jewish communities.

title.children: Sydney in 'heightened period' as police presence increased around Jewish sites

image.altText: Mum hold two small boys on her lap.

props.synopsis: Early childhood educators have long argued for childcare to be viewed as vital for childrenâs wellbeing, now the voters will decide at next yearâs election, writes Conor Duffy.

title.children: Parents missing out on childcare subsidy call for change

image.altText: A composite shows pictures of Rio Tinto and BHP signs atop tall buildings.

props.synopsis: Lawyers say hundreds of women have joined a lawsuit that alleges widespread and systemic sexual harassment and gender discrimination at Rio Tinto and BHP worksites.

title.children: Mining companies called out for using NDAs to 'blackmail' women

image.altText: Spoons full of different coloured and shaped tablets and capsules on a pink background.

props.synopsis: A range of supplements from cinnamon to chromium claim to improve metabolism and lower blood sugar levels. What's the evidence for them?

title.children: More Australians are being diagnosed with diabetes. Can supplements help?

image.altText: Wall Street traders in a happy mood.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has risen slightly, following a record-breaking performance on Wall Street as mega-cap tech stocks like Amazon, Alphabet, Meta and Tesla drove the Nasdaq to a record close above 20,000 points. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rises after Nasdaq's record-breaking session, Tesla share price climbs to highest level ever

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Oil and gas stocks drive ASX higher, European Union imposes more sanctions targeting Russian oil
Australian market follows Wall Street higher, ASX gains 0.2pc in early trade

image.altText: Ryan Kobayashi and two women hold pictures of missing woman Hannah Kobayashi.

props.synopsis: After disappearing from Los Angeles airport in November and being spotted walking across the Mexican border, the Hawaii woman's family says she is safe and well.

title.children: Missing US woman Hannah Kobayashi found safe

image.altText: Geminid meteor shower in Northern Hemisphere.

props.synopsis:
You'll have to get up super early this weekend to catch the best glimpse of Australia's best meteor shower before the Sun rises.

Â

title.children: The best Australian meteor shower of the year peaks this weekend. Here's how to see it

image.altText: A family of five Syrian refugees sitting on a brown couch.

props.synopsis: The Alrahmo family has spent eight years making a life in Australia since fleeing war-torn Syria with their six children. Now the Bashar al-Assad regime has fallen, they finally feel safe enough to consider returning home to see loved ones.Â

title.children: Syrian refugee family hopeful of seeing loved ones after fall of Assad

image.altText: Chrsi Wray wearing a dark suit and blue tie with lips pursed as he looks up and leans to his right

props.synopsis: FBI director Chris Wray will step down from his position in January, after US president-elect Donald Trump signalled his intent to fire him and replace him with Kash Patel.

title.children: FBI director to step down before Trump administration takes power

image.altText: Hannah Pennington talking on a phone and smiling

props.synopsis: When re-entering the dating world after ending a long-term relationship, Hannah decided to do things differently, putting the exhausting task of disguise behind her. Â

title.children: I used to hide my disabilities on dates. Now I realise I don't need a disguise

image.altText: Prince Abdulaziz bin Turki Al Faisal wearing white and brown robes and shawls while smiling with hands raised

props.synopsis: The Middle Eastern nation has won the right to host the tournament in 2034 despite major concerns migrant workers could die constructing the event.

title.children: Saudi Arabia to host FIFA World Cup despite sportswashing concerns

image.altText: A whole barramundi cooked on a BBQ

props.synopsis: Gulf fishers are delighting in the best barramundi season theyâve seen and bumper prawn hauls â and that's good news for festive tables.

title.children: Best seafood seen in over a decade hitting shelves for Christmas

image.altText: Three brown rabbits in a green field.

props.synopsis: Scientists are asking people to collect dead rabbits to help research whether biological tools are still effective in controlling surging wild rabbit populations across Australia.

title.children: Concerns biological control methods losing their potency as rabbit numbers explode

image.altText: Bucket of brown, murky water sitting under an outdoor tap. It looks disgusting.

props.synopsis: The last upgrade of the Yass Valley's water treatment plant was in 1990, with residents dealing with ongoing issues with the quality of their water.

title.children: Water upgrades coming for region where most won't drink from the tap

image.altText: A girl and her family.

props.synopsis: After an exam period marred by controversy, Victorian students receive their VCE exam results, with 41 Victorian students achieving the highest possible ATAR rank of 99.95.

title.children: Mixed emotions as VCE results arrive after exams marred by controversy

image.altText: The playground of Darlington Public School.

props.synopsis: Darlington Public School in Sydney's inner west has been awarded the World Building of the Year at the 2024 World Architectural Festival for its small yet mighty design.

title.children: Sydney public school wins World Building of the Year architecture award
